description.en: In relation to the aforementioned questions, the course will cover climate, biomes, species richness, biotic interactions, diversity of animals and plants (excursion in Botanical gardens), human impact on tropical ecosystems, and tropical research methods. The format of the course will be lectures, excursions, group assignments, reading and presenting scientific papers, and discussions.
description.et: Kooskõlas püstitatud eesmärkidega käsitletakse kursuses troopikapiirkondade kliimat, bioome, liigirikkust ja liikide vahelisi interaktsioone, loomastiku  ja taimestiku mitmekesisust (troopika kasvuhoonete külastamine), inimmõju troopika ökosüsteemidele ja spetsiifilisi välitöömeetodeid. Töövormideks on loengud, ekskursioonid, rühmatöö, teaduskirjanduse refereerimine ja arutelud.

objectives.en: Introduce tropical biology and research in the tropics. The course will be structured around the following questions; What is different about tropical biology? How has tropical biology contributed to important advancements in Biology? How does tropical biology work in practice? Which threats do tropical species face?
objectives.et: Tutvustada troopilisi ökosüsteeme ja valdkonnas läbiviidavat teaduslikku uurimustööd. Kursus keskendub järgmistele küsimustele. Mis on troopika bioloogias eripärast? Kuidas on troopikabioloogia kaasa aidanud bioloogia sõlmküsimuste lahendamisele? Milline on troopikabioloogia argipäev? Mis ohustab troopikaliike?

learning_outcomes.en: Have a better understanding of tropical biota, and further develop skills in collecting information from the internet and scientific literature, reading scientific papers, oral presentation, and group work.
learning_outcomes.et: Paremini mõista troopikakooslusi, edendada teaduskirjandusest ja internetist teabe hankimise vilumusi; arendada teadusartiklite lugemise, ettekande pidamise ja rühmatöö oskusi.

independent_work.et: The students have to read, present and discuss a scientific paper in tropical biology related to their own research topic (in temperate biology).

grade_preconditions.et: The students must participate in the 3 seminars, participate in the practical class to the Botanical Gardens and take the final test.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials: Book "Tropical Forest Community Ecology" (available for registered students)
